2:
"How long will you three torment me\q2 and discourage me by calling me wicked?


\q1
3:
You have insulted me many times;\q2 are you not ashamed for saying these things to me?
\q1
4:
Even if it were true that I had done wrong,\q2 I have not injured you!


\q1
5:
If you truly think that you are better than I am,\q2 and if you argue that I must be guilty because I am suffering,
\q1
6:
you should realize that it is God who has caused me to suffer.\q2 It is as though he has a net and that he has caught me in it.


\q1
7:
I cry out, 'People are murdering me!',\q2 but no one answers me.
\q1 I call out loudly, but there is no one, not even God, who acts fairly toward me.
\q1
9:
He has taken away my good reputation;\q2 it is as though he has removed a crown from my head.


\q1
10:
He batters me from every side, and I will soon die.\q2 I no longer expect him to do anything good for me.
\q1
11:
He attacks me because he is very angry at me;\q2 he considers me to be his enemy.
\q1
12:
It is as though he were sending his army to attack me;\q2 they surround my tent
\q2 and get ready to attack me.


\q1
13:
God has caused my brothers to abandon me,\q2 and for all those who know me to act like strangers to me.
\q1
14:
All my relatives and good friends have left me.

\q1
15:
The people who were guests in my house have forgotten me,\q2 and my female servants consider that I am a foreigner whom they do not know.
\q1
16:
When I summon my servants, they do not answer;\q2 When I plead with them to come to help me, they do not come.


\q1
17:
My breath smells very bad to my wife so she stays away from me,\q2 and my brothers detest me.
\q1
18:
Even young children despise me;\q2 when I stand up to talk to them, they laugh at me.
\q1
19:
My dearest friends detest me,\q2 and those whom I love very much have turned against me.


\q1
20:
My body is only skin and bones;\q2 I am barely alive.
\q1
21:
I plead with you, my three friends, pity me\q2 because God has struck me very hard.
\q1
22:
Why do you cause me to suffer, also? Do you think you are God?\q2 Why do you never get enough of accusing me of doing wrong?


\q1
23:
I wish that someone would take these words of mine\q2 and write them permanently in a book in order that people can read them.
\q1
24:
Or else, I wish that someone would carve my words on a rock with a chisel\q2 in order that they would last forever.


\q1
25:
But I know that the one who vindicates me in court is alive,\q2 and that some day he will stand here on the earth and make the final decision about whether I deserve to be punished.
\q1
26:
And even after diseases have destroyed my body,\q2 still, in my body I will see God.
\q1
27:
I will see him myself;\q2 I will see him with my own eyes!
\q2 My emotions overwhelm me as I think about that!


\q1
28:
If you three men say, 'This is how we will cause him to suffer!'\q2 and you say, 'He is the one who has caused his own troubles,'
\q1
29:
you should fear that God will punish you;\q1 he punishes those like you with whom he is angry;
\q2 and when that happens, you will know that there is someone who judges people."
